intro: Limonium × dolcheri, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the Plumbagaceae family. It is native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the western coasts of Europe. The plant is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and narrow, silver-green leaves that are adapted to salty, windy environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dunes or along the shorelines. Limonium × dolcheri is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
